results.title: Christianity: the way of goodness and mercy
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Religions of the world”.
Christianity is a religion which has more followers than any other. Jesus Christ is the central figure of worship and his life, deeds and teachings had a profound effect on human history. Shot in various locations, the program discusses everything from the Sermon on the Mount to the Dead Sea Scrolls.

results.title: Buddhism: the middle way of compassion
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Religions of the world”.
A compassionate view of life, Buddhism has had a profound influence on the philosophical and political development of the nations of Asia. People in the West are becoming increasingly attracted to Buddhism and there are over 250 million followers. This episode looks at the life of the Buddha and at different types of Buddhist beliefs.

results.title: Ancient religions of the Mediterranean
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Religions of the world”.
This documentary turns its focus back into history to examine the diverse spiritual traditions of ancient Mediterranean cultures, and offer insight as to how the rituals and belief systems of these societies may have influenced modern religions such as Christianity, Islam and Judaism. Humanity’s basic desire to co-exist in harmony with the natural world was one of the primary factors involved with the increasing worship and deification of animal spirits. Agricultural advances saw wild animals - and therefore, wild spirits - being simultaneously domesticated. Gods and goddesses portrayed in a more accessible human form, or in a human form merged with that of an animal, grew in popularity. From Mesopotamia and Egypt to the Greek and Roman empires, different forms of worship, underpinned by similar archetypal myths and images, flourished and expanded. Narrated by Ben Kingsley. Includes teacher’s notes.

results.title: The AIF's Great Route March : Review No 460
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
This Cinesound newsreel consists of footage of the AIF’s Great Route March - a training march across the Blue Mountains to Bathurst which took twelve days over one hundred and thirty miles.

results.title: Drought grips Riverina
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
An edition of the weekly Cinesound newsreel (Ep. 679) consisting of one “full-reel” item: “Drought grips Riverina”, alerting the public to the severity of the drought, and criticising the destructive abuse of the land by farmers who overstock. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
